email:
Subject: Application Fee Payment Issue for Graduate Program in Software Engineering

Dear Admissions Team, I am writing to seek your assistance regarding a technical issue I am experiencing with paying the application fee for my graduate program in Software Engineering at University College London (UCL). My name is John Doe and I have submitted an online application for the MSc program. However, when attempting to pay the â‚¬390 application fee using my credit card, I encountered an error message indicating that the payment was not going through. Despite multiple attempts, I am unable to complete the payment process. Could you please advise me on what steps I can take to resolve this issue? Is there an alternative method of payment that I can use, or would it be possible for me to pay by other means (e.g. bank transfer)? I have already submitted my online application and I am eager to proceed with the rest of the admissions process. Please let me know if you require any additional information from me. Thank you for your prompt assistance in this matter. I look forward to hearing back from you soon. Sincerely, John Doe

questions.question: Why is my application fee payment not going through?
questions.answer:
There can be a number of reasons why your payment is not going through:

Please do not use a Firefox browser to make your payment.
The payment system does not accept special characters, please ensure that you only use anglicised characters when making the payment.
The payment may have been blocked by your card issuer/bank. You should contact them to inform them that you are making an overseas payment.
You can access Flywire's FAQs, useful videos and articles, and also access the Flywire 24/7 Live Chat and speak with our global support team instantly.

Get help from Flywire

prompt:
Your name is John Doe and you are applying for a graduate program in Software Engineering. 
      You are a local student that is interested in the MSc program at UCL.
      
      Write an email to UCL admissions asking the following questions:
 
      Why is my application fee payment not going through?
gold:
Dear John Doe,
 
 Thank you for reaching out regarding your issue with the application fee payment for the MSc Software Engineering program at UCL.
 
 There are several potential reasons for the payment issue you are experiencing, and we recommend the following steps to help resolve it:
 
 Browser Compatibility: Avoid using the Firefox browser for your payment. We recommend trying an alternative browser such as Google Chrome or Safari.
 
 Special Characters: Ensure that your payment details do not include any special characters. Only use anglicized characters when entering your information.
 
 Bank Approval: The issue may be due to your card issuer or bank blocking the transaction. Please contact your bank and inform them that you are making an international payment to ensure the transaction is authorized.
 
 Flywire Support: UCL's payment system utilizes Flywire, a global payment platform. Flywire offers extensive support, including FAQs, useful videos, and articles. Additionally, their 24/7 Live Chat feature allows you to speak with a global support team member instantly. You can access these resources and support through the Flywire website.
 
 If these steps do not resolve the issue, please let us know, and we will assist you further or explore alternative payment options, such as a bank transfer.
 
 We appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and look forward to assisting you further if needed.
  Best regards,
[Admissions Team 
 University College London
